results.title: The Cup and the lip
results.creator_credit: Joanna Robinski, Bruno de Villenoisy and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A difficult child and a good mother. A loose tooth, a sign on a wall, an imaginary word, ecstasy, anger… A disturbing film about the ultimate taboo.
Cast: Gosia Dobrowolska, Julian Barta
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joanna Robinski, Bruno de Villenoisy and AFTRS

results.title: Louise
results.creator_credit: Kelly Schilling, Joe Weatherstone, Steven McGregor and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A short documentary about a woman named Louise Mitchie who was born as a replacement child - a child conceived and born in order to help with the grief experienced by parents who had lost their first child in infancy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kelly Schilling, Joe Weatherstone, Steven McGregor and AFTRS

results.title: D-evolution
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Searle, Joe Weatherstone, Steven McGregor and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
When the Huntress Shar catches her prey, the gorgeous Khan, in a lush forest glade, she thinks she’s come to the end of her hunt. But it’s only the beginning…
Combining traditional and contemporary visual effects tools, D-evolution attempts to tell a story about technology and reality, using technology itself to shape the visuals of the film.
Cast: Kate Beahan, Aaron Pedersen, Alana De Roma, Anni Finsterer
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicholas Searle, Joe Weatherstone, Steven McGregor and AFTRS

results.title: Range of experience
results.creator_credit: Anne Pratten, Lisa Duff, Marc Gillezeau, Maryella Hatfield and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
It is the future - a world where the ability to experience life’s basic emotions has been lost to humanity and Virtual Reality has replaced dreams. The company Range of Experience Productions Inc has invented the Dream Base Selector, a machine which enables users to re-live experiences once created naturally by the subconscious mind. But it soon becomes apparent that the technology is slightly faulty…
Cast: Soledad Cordeaux
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anne Pratten, Lisa Duff, Marc Gillezeau, Maryella Hatfield and AFTRS

results.title: Eden
results.creator_credit: Anne Pratten, Maryella Hatfield and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
The Aboriginal relationship with the land in Australia is the original human relationship. The European conquest continues, with little change, in the destruction of NSW’s south east forests to this day.
Commentary by Benjamin Cruse (Eden Lands Council).
results.description:
The Aboriginal relationship with the land in Australia is the original human relationship. The European conquest continues, with little change, in the destruction of NSW’s south east forests to this day.
Commentary by Benjamin Cruse (Eden Lands Council).

results.title: True justice?
results.brief_description: Documentary containing sensitive material about the death, in 2004, of a young 17 year-old Aboriginal boy from Gamilaroi country (Walgett) known as TJ Hickey. Through interviews and news footage, the film attempts to establish the truth of what really happened to TJ whose “acccidental” death not only triggered a riot between the Redfern community and the police, but also conspiracy theories, rumours and media misinformation.
results.description: Documentary containing sensitive material about the death, in 2004, of a young 17 year-old Aboriginal boy from Gamilaroi country (Walgett) known as TJ Hickey. Through interviews and news footage, the film attempts to establish the truth of what really happened to TJ whose “acccidental” death not only triggered a riot between the Redfern community and the police, but also conspiracy theories, rumours and media misinformation.
description_for_label: Documentary containing sensitive material about the death, in 2004, of a young 17 year-old Aboriginal boy from Gamilaroi country (Walgett) known as TJ Hickey. Through interviews and news footage, the film attempts to establish the truth of what really happened to TJ whose “acccidental” death not only triggered a riot between the Redfern community and the police, but also conspiracy theories, rumours and media misinformation.

results.title: Left lane ends
results.creator_credit: Alice Addison, Steve Pasvolsky, Sofya Gollan and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Not paid sex, not Sleep-Eez, not working the late-night shift can help Danny sleep. Not until his ritual gets invaded by a girl.
Cast: Sam Lewis, Kate Beahan, Kris McQuade, Russell Cheek

results.title: The Road home
results.creator_credit: Robert Nugent, Kelrick Martin and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Documentary about Roy Read who was raised an orphan and told he wasn’t Aboriginal - just “darker than others”. At Kinchela Boys’ Home he was subjected to the horrors of institutionalised life. Now 49 years later, he returns to face the demons of his past - and reconnect with the family he never knew he had. Contains archival b&w stills
results.description: Documentary about Roy Read who was raised an orphan and told he wasn’t Aboriginal - just “darker than others”. At Kinchela Boys’ Home he was subjected to the horrors of institutionalised life. Now 49 years later, he returns to face the demons of his past - and reconnect with the family he never knew he had. Contains archival b&w stills
description_for_label: Documentary about Roy Read who was raised an orphan and told he wasn’t Aboriginal - just “darker than others”. At Kinchela Boys’ Home he was subjected to the horrors of institutionalised life. Now 49 years later, he returns to face the demons of his past - and reconnect with the family he never knew he had. Contains archival b&w stills

results.title: Your brother, my tidda
results.creator_credit: Kathy Sport, Kelrick Martin and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
“Coming out” to family, living with HIV and religion - some of the life changing situations faced by two Aboriginal gay men, Sam Barsah and Aaron Clark.
Sam has “come out” twice; first to his family about his sexuality and then about his HIV status. Like other indigenous gay men, he wants respect and understanding and only now, almost ten years later, does he feel able to speak openly about his story. Aaron is young and relatively new to Sydney. Growing up as a Jehovah’s Witness, he is looking for an alternative gay Christian group.
Using a contemporary blend of semi-observational filming, photos and animation, this short documentary about race and sexuality describes two very different stories of being Aboriginal and gay.
N.B. “Tidda” is an Aboriginal word for “sister”.
